intro: Lasiostoma divaricata, commonly known as the variable mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on a variety of host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant lacks true roots and absorbs water and nutrients through its specialized haustoria that attach to the host's vascular system. Lasiostoma divaricata plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for birds and insects while also influencing the health of its host trees.
